title: Verify successful registration with valid data
description: Validate that a user can successfully register with valid details
preconditions: User is on the registration page; registration form is visible.
postconditions: A new account is created and the user is redirected to the dashboard, signed-in.
steps_actions:
1. "Select the appropriate social title radiobutton - Mr. or Mrs."
2. "Enter a valid first name, last name, and email."
3. "Enter a strong, valid password."
4. "Complete the optional field - birthdate."
5. "Accept terms and conditions."
6. "Accept customer data privacy."
7. "Click the \"Save\" button."
steps_result:
1. "The appropriate radiobutton is selected."
2. "Text fields populate with the entered information."
3. "Password is accepted and hidden behind asterisks or similar masking."
4. "Text fields populate with the entered information."
5. "Checkbox is selected."
6. "Checkbox is selected."
7. "User is successfully registered and redirected to the dashboard, signed-in."

title: Verify registration fails with invalid email format
description: Validate that the system rejects registration attempts with an invalid email format.
preconditions: User is on the registration page.
postconditions: No account is created; the user remains on the registration page with an error message.
steps_actions:
1. "Select the appropriate social title radiobutton - Mr. or Mrs."
2. "Enter a valid first name and last name."
3. "Enter an invalid email format (e.g., \"user@domain\")."
4. "Enter a strong, valid password."
5. "Accept terms and conditions."
6. "Accept customer data privacy."
7. "Click the \"Save\" button."
steps_result:
1. "The appropriate radiobutton is selected."
2. "Text fields populate with the entered information."
3. "Email field accepts input, but format does not meet validation criteria."
4. "Password is accepted and hidden behind asterisks or similar masking."
5. "Checkbox is selected."
6. "Checkbox is selected."
7. "Registration fails; an error message indicating \"Invalid email format\" is displayed."

title: Verify registration fails with unchecked mandatory checkbox
description: Validate that the system rejects registration attempts with the “Customer Data Privacy” checkbox not checked.
preconditions: User is on the registration page.
postconditions: No account is created; the user remains on the registration page with an information message “Check this box if you want to continue” displayed.
steps_actions:
1. "Select the appropriate social title radiobutton - Mr. or Mrs."
2. "Enter a valid first name, last name, and email."
3. "Enter a strong, valid password."
4. "Accept terms and conditions."
5. "Click the \"Save\" button."
steps_result:
1. "The appropriate radiobutton is selected."
2. "Text fields populate with the entered information."
3. "Password is accepted and hidden behind asterisks or similar masking."
4. "Checkbox is selected."
5. "Registration fails; an information message indicating \u201cCheck this box if you want to continue\u201d is displayed."

title: Successful login with valid credentials
description: Verify that a user can successfully sign in with valid credentials.
preconditions: User has a registered account; login page is accessible.
postconditions: User is signed-in and directed to the dashboard.
steps_actions:
1. "Enter valid email and password."
2. "Click the \"Sign In\" button."
steps_result:
1. "Credentials are entered correctly and match stored user data."
2. "Login is successful; user is redirected to the dashboard."

title: Verify login fails with incorrect password
description: Ensure login fails when an incorrect password is entered.
preconditions: User has a registered account; login page is accessible.
postconditions: User remains on the login page with an error message indicating incorrect credentials.
steps_actions:
1. "Enter a valid email but an incorrect password."
2. "Click the \"Sign In\" button."
steps_result:
1. "Incorrect password is accepted into the password field."
2. "Login fails; an error message stating \"Authentication failed\" appears."

title: Verify search functionality with valid product name (non-signed-in user)
description: Confirm that searching with a valid product name returns relevant results for non-signed-in user.
preconditions: User is not signed-in. Products are available in the system; search bar is accessible.
postconditions: Search results page displays products matching the search term.
steps_actions:
1. "Enter a specific product name (e.g., \"T-shirt\") into the search bar."
2. "Click 'Enter'."
steps_result:
1. "Product name is accepted and visible in the search bar."
2. "Relevant search results matching the product name are displayed."

title: Verify adding a single product to the cart (non-signed-in user)
description: Validate that a non-signed-in user can add a single item to the shopping cart.
preconditions: User is not signed-in and has navigated to the random product page.
postconditions: Product is added to the cart, and cart count updates accordingly.
steps_actions:
1. "Search for the product and navigate to its product page."
2. "Click the \"Add to Cart\" button."
steps_result:
1. "Product page for the selected book is displayed."
2. "Product is added to the cart; cart icon updates to reflect the added item."

title: Verify adding products to the cart in different variants and quantities (non-signed-in user)
description: Validate that a non-signed-in user can add different products to the cart after changing their details such as size, color, quantity.
preconditions: User is not signed-in and has navigated to the random product page.
postconditions: Products are added to the cart in the appropriate variants that the user has selected.
steps_actions:
1. "Search for the product and navigate to its product page."
2. "Change product size, color and quantity (for example to 15)."
3. "Click the \"Add to Cart\" button."
4. "Search for another product and navigate to it's page."
5. "Change product size, color and quantity (for example to 15)."
6. "Click the \"Add to Cart\" button."
steps_result:
1. "Product page for the selected item is displayed."
2. "Product details changed accordingly."
3. "Product is added to the cart; cart icon updates to reflect the added item."
4. "Product page for the selected item is displayed."
5. "Product details changed accordingly."
6. "Product is added to the cart; cart icon updates to reflect the added item."

title: Verify product quantity change from the cart level (non-signed-in user)
description: Validate that a non-signed-in user can change product quantity in the “Shopping Cart” page.
preconditions: User is not signed-in and has navigated to the “Shopping Cart” page. There is a clothing product in the cart, e.g. a T-shirt.
postconditions: The product with the changed quantity is in the cart.
steps_actions:
1. "Change the number of products in the cart, e.g. to 20."
2. "Change the number of products in the cart to 401."
steps_result:
1. "Product number changed to 20, price recalculated according to the new quantity."
2. "An error message appears \u201cThe available purchase order quantity for this product is 400\"."

title: Verify product size change from the cart level (non-signed-in user)
description: Validate that a non-signed-in user can change product size in the “Shopping Cart” page.
preconditions: User is not signed-in and has navigated to the “Shopping Cart” page. There is a clothing product in the cart, e.g. a T-shirt.
postconditions: The product with the changed size is in the cart
steps_actions: 1. "Change the product size, using drop-down list for the product."
steps_result: 1. "Product size has changed."

title: Verify adding a product to wishlist (non-signed-in user)
description: Verify that a non-signed-in user can add products to the wishlist.
preconditions: User is not signed-in; they are on the product page of an item they want to add to the wishlist.
postconditions: Product is added to the temporary wishlist. The wishlist is cleared later after 24 hours.
steps_actions:
1. "Navigate to a product page (e.g., \"T-shirt\") without signing in."
2. "Click the \"Add to Wishlist\" button."
steps_result:
1. "Product page is displayed with all product information and options, including the \"Add to Wishlist\" heart-shaped button."
2. "The product is added to a temporary wishlist that will be cleared after 24 hours."

title: Verify removing a product from wishlist (non-signed-in user)
description: Verify that a non-signed-in user can remove products from the wishlist.
preconditions: User is not signed-in; they are on the temporary wishlist page with the product added to this list.
postconditions: Product is removed from the temporary wishlist.
steps_actions:
1. "Click on the button in the shape of trash can in the product preview image."
2. "Click \u201cRemove\u201d."
steps_result:
1. "A window appears to confirm the execution of the action \"The product will be removed from wishlist\"."
2. "A green toast message \"Product successfully removed\" appears on the screen."

title: Verify filter by singe criteria (non-signed-in user)
description: Verify that applying single filter displays only products that belong to the selected criteria for non-signed-in user.
preconditions: User is not signed-in. Multiple products are available across different categories, and the user is on the product search or category page.
postconditions: The page should display only products in the selected criteria or reset to the default product view if filters are cleared.
steps_actions: 1. "Select \u201cClothes\u201d category and then apply a specific filter (e.g., \"Men\")."
steps_result: 1. "The filter is selected, and the page shows a loading spinner or indicator that the filter is being applied. The page automatically reloads and shows clothes only from the \u201cMen\u201d category.\u00a0 No products from other categories are shown."

title: Verify filter by multiple criteria (non-signed-in user)
description: Validate that applying multiple filters together narrows down the product search results to meet all selected criteria for non-signed-in user.
preconditions: User is not signed-in. Products are available across different categories and price ranges.
postconditions: The page should display only products that match the applied criteria or reset to the default product view if filters are cleared.
steps_actions:
1. "Select \u201cAccessories\u201d category and then apply a specific filter (e.g., Composition \u201cPolyester\u201d)."
2. "Apply an additional filer e.g., Composition \u201cRecycled cardboard\u201d."
steps_result:
1. "The filter is selected, and the page shows a loading spinner or indicator that the filter is being applied. The page automatically reloads and shows Polyester accessories.\u00a0 No accessories of other composition are shown."
2. "The page shows a loading spinner or indicator that the filter is being applied. The page automatically reloads and shows accessories made of polyester and recycled cardboard. No accessories of other composition are shown."

title: Verify checkout process with valid data (non-signed-in user)
description: Ensure that the checkout process for non-signed-in user completes successfully with valid user details and payment information.
preconditions: User is not signed-in with items in their cart.
postconditions: Order is successfully placed, and an order confirmation page is displayed.
steps_actions:
1. "Navigate to the cart and click \"Proceed to Checkout.\""
2. "Enter valid personal information \u2013 first name, last name, email. Check mandatory checkboxes \u2013 Terms and Conditions agreement and Data Privacy. Click \u201ccontinue\u201d."
3. "Enter valid address information \u2013 address, Zip\/Postal Code, City and Country. The remaining fields are optional - they may or may not be filled. Click \u201ccontinue\u201d."
4. "Click \u201cContinue\u201d."
5. "Provide information about card details - number, security code and card expiration date. Accept Terms & Conditions and click \u201cPlace Order\u201d."
steps_result:
1. "User is taken to the checkout page with a summary of items."
2. "The personal information section closes - an icon with a green tick appears next to it, indicating that the section has been completed correctly. The \"addresses\" section opens with first and last name fields filled automatically."
3. "The address information section closes - an icon with a green tick appears next to it, indicating that the section has been completed correctly. The \"Shipping Method\" section opens. Only \u201cMy Carrier\u201d option is available. Radiobutton next to it is automatically selected."
4. "The \u201cShipping Method\u201d section closes - an icon with a green tick appears next to it, indicating that the section has been completed correctly. The \"Payment\" section opens with fillable fields for entering debit\/credit card details."
5. "Order is successfully placed; confirmation page with order details appears."

title: Verify checkout fails with invalid credit card information (non-signed-in user)
description: Confirm that the checkout process for non-signed-in user fails when invalid credit card information is entered.
preconditions: User is not signed-in with items in the cart; checkout page is accessible.
postconditions: Order is not placed; error message indicates invalid payment details.
steps_actions:
1. "Navigate to the cart and click \"Proceed to Checkout.\""
2. "Enter valid personal information \u2013 first name, last name, email. Check mandatory checkboxes \u2013 Terms and Conditions agreement and Data Privacy. Click \u201cContinue\u201d."
3. "Enter valid address information \u2013 address, Zip\/Postal Code, City and Country. The remaining fields are optional - they may or may not be filled."
4. "Click \u201cContinue\u201d."
5. "Provide incorrect card details - e.g. the card number should be in the wrong format - instead of 12 characters, make it 9. Accept Terms & Conditions and click \u201cPlace Order\u201d."
steps_result:
1. "User is taken to the checkout page with a summary of items."
2. "The personal information section closes - an icon with a green tick appears next to it, indicating that the section has been completed correctly. The \"addresses\" section opens with first and last name fields filled automatically."
3. "The address information section closes - an icon with a green tick appears next to it, indicating that the section has been completed correctly. The \"Shipping Method\" section opens. Only \u201cMy Carrier\u201d option is available. Radiobutton next to it is automatically selected."
4. "The \u201cShipping Method\u201d section closes - an icon with a green tick appears next to it, indicating that the section has been completed correctly. The \"Payment\" section opens with fillable fields for entering debit\/credit card details."
5. "Order is not placed; error message indicates invalid payment details."

title: Verify adding a product to wishlist (signed-in user)
description: Ensure that a signed-in user can successfully add a product to their wishlist.
preconditions: User is signed-in and on the product page of an item they want to add to the wishlist.
postconditions: The product is added to the user's wishlist, which is accessible from their account.
steps_actions:
1. "Navigate to a product page (e.g., \"T-shirt\")."
2. "Click the \"Add to Wishlist\" button."
3. "Click on \u201cMy wishlist\u201d."
4. "Go to the \"Wishlist\" section under the user account."
steps_result:
1. "Product page is displayed with all product information and options, including the \"Add to Wishlist\" heart-shaped button."
2. "A window appears in which the user can select the list in which he wants to save the product."
3. "The list selection window closes. A green toast message \"Product Added\" appears on the screen."
4. "The product appears in the wishlist with an option to view, add to cart, edit or remove it."

description: Verify that a signed-in user can remove product from wishlist.
preconditions: User is signed-in; they are on the wishlist page with the product added to this list.
postconditions: Product is removed from the wishlist.
steps_actions:
1. "Click on the button in the shape of trash can in the product preview image."
2. "Click \u201cRemove\u201d."
steps_result:
1. "A window appears to confirm the execution of the action \"The product will be removed from My wishlist\"."
2. "A green toast message \"Product successfully removed\" appears on the screen."

title: Verify filter by multiple criteria (signed-in user)
description: Validate that applying multiple filters together narrows down the product search results to meet all selected criteria for signed-in user.

postconditions: The page should display only products that match the applied criteria or reset to the default product view if filters are cleared.
steps_actions:

title: Verify checkout process with valid data (signed-in user)
description: Ensure that the checkout process for signed-in user completes successfully with valid user details and payment information.
preconditions: User is signed-in with items in their cart.
postconditions: Order is successfully placed, and an order confirmation page is displayed.
steps_actions:
1. "Navigate to the cart and click \"Proceed to Checkout.\""
2. "Enter valid address information \u2013 Address, Zip\/Postal Code and City. The remaining fields are optional - they may or may not be filled. Click \u201cContinue\u201d."
3. "Select option \u201cClick and Collect\u201d then click \u201cContinue\u201d."
4. "Choose any option, e.g. \u201cPay by cash and delivery\u201d. Accept Terms & Conditions and click \u201cPlace Order\u201d."
steps_result:
1. "User is taken to the checkout page with a summary of items. Personal information is automatically completed. The \"addresses\" section opens with first, last name and country fields filled automatically."
2. "The address information section closes - an icon with a green tick appears next to it, indicating that the section has been completed correctly. The \"Shipping Method\" section opens. Two options are available \u2013 \u201cClick and Collect\u201d (Pick-up in store) and \u201cMy Carrier\u201d."
3. "The \u201cShipping Method\u201d section closes - an icon with a green tick appears next to it, indicating that the section has been completed correctly. The \"Payment\" section opens with three available payment methods: \u201cPay by bank wire\u201d, \u201cPay by cash and delivery\u201d and \u201cPay by check\u201d. There is no option for adding debit\/credit card details for signed-in users."
4. "Order is successfully placed; confirmation page with order details appears."

title: Homepage Navigation (Chrome)
description: Ensuring that the homepage is functional, user-friendly, and that all navigation elements (links, menus, banners, etc.) are accessible and lead to the correct destinations in the newest version of Google Chrome. It will also assess the responsiveness and accessibility of the homepage across different screen sizes.
preconditions:
* The demo Prestashop site is live and accessible from the browser.
* The user has appropriate permissions to view and interact with the website.
* The browser is up-to-date.
postconditions:
* The homepage should be fully accessible with no broken links or navigation issues.
* All pages that are linked from the homepage should function correctly and load with the expected content.
steps_actions:
1. "Navigate to the homepage of the site in the browser."
2. "Click on each category link in the main menu (\"Clothes\", \"Accessories\", \"Art\")."
3. "Scroll down to the footer and click on links such as \"Contact Us\" and \"Terms and conditions of use\"."
4. "Click on one or more featured products displayed on the homepage."
5. "Click on any promotional banners or sliders located on the homepage."
6. "Enter a product name or keyword into the search bar and press \"Enter.\""
7. "Test the homepage on multiple screen sizes (e.g., desktop, tablet, and mobile). This can be done using function in the homepage header or developer tools."
steps_result:
1. "The homepage loads fully, with no errors or broken images. It should display the main menu, featured products, banners, footer, and the search bar."
2. "Each category should load the correct page with the expected product list or category content. There should be no errors or 404 pages. All links should be functional and redirect to the appropriate pages."
3. "Footer links should lead to the correct pages without any broken links. The pages should load promptly and display the appropriate content."
4. "The product detail page should load correctly, showing the relevant product information (e.g., price, description, product details, images, and \"Add to Cart\" & \"Add to Wishlist buttons). There should be no broken images or missing content."
5. "The linked page should load and display content relevant to the promotion (e.g., discounts, sales pages). The banner should redirect to the correct page without errors."
6. "The search results should display relevant products or categories based on the search term. If no results are found, a friendly \"no results\" message should be shown. The results should load without significant delays."
7. "The homepage should be responsive, with all elements adjusting to fit the screen size. The navigation, images, and text should be clear, and clickable elements should be appropriately sized for mobile use. No layout or functionality issues should occur."

title: Homepage Navigation (Microsoft Edge)
description: Ensuring that the homepage is functional, user-friendly, and that all navigation elements (links, menus, banners, etc.) are accessible and lead to the correct destinations in the newest version of Microsoft Edge. It will also assess the responsiveness and accessibility of the homepage across different screen sizes.
preconditions:
* The demo Prestashop site is live and accessible from the browser.
* The user has appropriate permissions to view and interact with the website.
* The browser is up-to-date.
postconditions:
* The homepage should be fully accessible with no broken links or navigation issues.
* All pages that are linked from the homepage should function correctly and load with the expected content.
steps_actions:
1. "Navigate to the homepage of the site in the browser."
2. "Click on each category link in the main menu (\"Clothes\", \"Accessories\", \"Art\")."
3. "Scroll down to the footer and click on links such as \"Contact Us\" and \"Terms and conditions of use\"."
4. "Click on one or more featured products displayed on the homepage."
5. "Click on any promotional banners or sliders located on the homepage."
6. "Enter a product name or keyword into the search bar and press \"Enter.\""
7. "Test the homepage on multiple screen sizes (e.g., desktop, tablet, and mobile). This can be done using function in the homepage header or developer tools."
steps_result:
1. "The homepage loads fully, with no errors or broken images. It should display the main menu, featured products, banners, footer, and the search bar."
2. "Each category should load the correct page with the expected product list or category content. There should be no errors or 404 pages. All links should be functional and redirect to the appropriate pages."
3. "Footer links should lead to the correct pages without any broken links. The pages should load promptly and display the appropriate content."
4. "The product detail page should load correctly, showing the relevant product information (e.g., price, description, product details, images, and \"Add to Cart\" & \"Add to Wishlist buttons). There should be no broken images or missing content."
5. "The linked page should load and display content relevant to the promotion (e.g., discounts, sales pages). The banner should redirect to the correct page without errors."
6. "The search results should display relevant products or categories based on the search term. If no results are found, a friendly \"no results\" message should be shown. The results should load without significant delays."
7. "The homepage should be responsive, with all elements adjusting to fit the screen size. The navigation, images, and text should be clear, and clickable elements should be appropriately sized for mobile use. No layout or functionality issues should occur."

title: Page Load Time
description: Ensure that the page load time meets the expected performance standards.
preconditions:
* Newest version of Google Chrome is installed, network connection is stable.


* The demo Prestashop site is live and accessible from the browser.
* The user has appropriate permissions to view and interact with the website.
postconditions: The page load time has been documented.
steps_actions:
1. "Open Prestashop homepage."
2. "Open Developer Tools."
3. "Go to the **Network** tab and reload the page."
4. "Monitor the **Load Time** (total time for the page to load). Look at the **Total Duration** at the bottom of the Network tab."
steps_result:
1. "The browser opens the homepage successfully without errors."
2. "Developer Tools window opens with tabs like Network, Performance, Console, etc."
3. "The page reloads, and network requests are captured in the Network tab."
4. "The total page load time should be less than **3 seconds**."

title: Time to Interactive (TTI)
description: Measure how quickly the page becomes interactive and usable by the user after loading.
preconditions:
* Newest version of Google Chrome is installed, network connection is stable.


* The demo Prestashop site is live and accessible from the browser.
* The user has appropriate permissions to view and interact with the website.
postconditions: TTI measurement has been recorded.
steps_actions:
1. "Open Prestashop homepage in Google Chrome."
2. "Open Developer Tools."
3. "Go to the **Performance** tab."
4. "Click **Record** and reload the page."
5. "Wait for the page to load completely, then stop the recording."
6. "Look for **Time to Interactive (TTI)** in the summary."
steps_result:
1. "The homepage is loaded in the browser."
2. "Developer Tools window opens with the Performance tab."
3. "The Performance tab is selected, and recording options are visible."
4. "Recording starts, and the page is reloaded for performance tracking."
5. "The recording stops once the page is fully loaded."
6. "TTI is under **5 seconds.**"

title: JavaScript Execution Performance
description: Test the performance impact of JavaScript execution on page loading and responsiveness.
preconditions:
* Newest version of Google Chrome is installed, network connection is stable.


* The demo Prestashop site is live and accessible from the browser.
* The user has appropriate permissions to view and interact with the website.


* Developer Tools are accessible.
postconditions: JavaScript execution time has been reviewed.
steps_actions:
1. "Open Prestashop homepage in Google Chrome."
2. "Open Developer Tools."
3. "Go to the **Performance** tab."
4. "Record a page load while monitoring JavaScript execution time."
5. "Once the recording is complete, review the **JavaScript execution time** (listed under \u201cScripting\u201d)."
steps_result:
1. "The homepage loads successfully."
2. "Developer Tools window opens with various tabs."
3. "The Performance tab is selected and ready to record."
4. "Recording starts, capturing JavaScript execution metrics."
5. "JavaScript execution should take less than **1 second**."

title: CSS Rendering Performance
description: Measure how quickly the site renders CSS styles after the initial HTML load.
preconditions:
* Newest version of Google Chrome is installed, network connection is stable.


* The demo Prestashop site is live and accessible from the browser.
* The user has appropriate permissions to view and interact with the website.


* Developer Tools are accessible.
postconditions: CSS rendering performance data documented.
steps_actions:
1. "Open Prestashop homepage in Google Chrome."
2. "Open Developer Tools."
3. "Go to the **Performance** tab."
4. "Record the page load while monitoring CSS rendering time."
5. "Review the **CSS Rendering Time** in the timeline of the performance recording."
steps_result:
1. "Homepage opens in the browser."
2. "Developer Tools open with multiple tabs."
3. "The Performance tab is selected for performance monitoring."
4. "Recording starts, capturing rendering details."
5. "CSS rendering time should be under **2 seconds** after HTML load."

title: Browser Resource Consumption
description: Test how efficiently the website uses browser resources (e.g., CPU, memory) during typical browsing.
preconditions:
* Newest version of Google Chrome is installed, network connection is stable.


* The demo Prestashop site is live and accessible from the browser.
* The user has appropriate permissions to view and interact with the website.


* Developer Tools are accessible.
postconditions: Browser resource usage data has been reviewed.
steps_actions:
1. "Open Prestashop homepage in Google Chrome."
2. "Open Developer Tools and go to Performance tab."
3. "Record the page load and navigate around the site (e.g., add items to the cart, browse categories)."
4. "Observe the **CPU and memory usage** during navigation and interactions."
steps_result:
1. "The homepage is loaded without errors."
2. "The Performance tab opens, ready for recording."
3. "Page load and navigation events are captured for resource monitoring."
4. "CPU and memory usage should remain **under 50%** CPU utilization."

title: SQL Injection
description: Ensure the application is not vulnerable to SQL injection attacks.
preconditions:
* Newest version of Google Chrome is installed, network connection is stable.
* The demo Prestashop is open in browser.
* The user has appropriate permissions to view and interact with the website.
postconditions: Any SQL injection vulnerabilities are documented.
steps_actions:
1. "Identify a form or input field (e.g., login form, search bar, contact form)."
2. "Enter a malicious SQL query into the field (e.g., `'; DROP TABLE users; --`)."
3. "Monitor the application\u2019s behavior (e.g., error messages or unexpected results)."
steps_result:
1. "Input field is accessible and functional."
2. "The application should display an error or handle the input gracefully without breaking or exposing data."
3. "No sensitive data is exposed (e.g., \"SQL syntax error\") or unauthorized actions performed."

title: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
description: Ensure the application is protected against XSS attacks.
preconditions:
* Newest version of Google Chrome is installed, network connection is stable.
* The demo Prestashop is open in browser.
* The user has appropriate permissions to view and interact with the website.
postconditions: Application handles potentially malicious input securely.
steps_actions:
1. "Identify any input fields or content sections (e.g., order tracking)."
2. "Input a script tag (e.g., `<script>alert('XSS');<\/script>`)."
3. "Submit the input and observe the behavior of the page."
steps_result:
1. "Input fields are functional."
2. "The input should be sanitized or rejected."
3. "The script should not execute, and no unauthorized actions (e.g., pop-ups or alerts) should occur."

title: User Authentication Security
description: Verify that user authentication is secure and prevents unauthorized access.
preconditions:
* Newest version of Google Chrome is installed, network connection is stable.
* The demo Prestashop is open in browser.
* The user has appropriate permissions to view and interact with the website.


* User account exists.
postconditions: Authentication mechanisms function securely.
steps_actions:
1. "Log in to Prestashop with valid credentials."
2. "Attempt to log in with incorrect credentials multiple times."
3. "Observe error messages for failed logins."
steps_result:
1. "Login is successful and redirects to the appropriate user dashboard."
2. "Account should lock or display a CAPTCHA after 5 failed attempts."
3. "Generic error message \"Authentication failed.\" is displayed without revealing specific details."

title: Session Management
description: Test the security of session handling.
preconditions:
* Newest version of Google Chrome is installed, network connection is stable.
* The demo Prestashop is open in browser.
* The user has appropriate permissions to view and interact with the website.
* User account exists.
postconditions: Session-related vulnerabilities are identified.
steps_actions:
1. "Log in to the application and perform standard actions."
2. "Log out and attempt to use the browser\u2019s back button to access a restricted page."
3. "Inspect cookies using browser tools (e.g., Chrome DevTools) and note their attributes (e.g., `Secure`, `HttpOnly`)."
steps_result:
1. "Actions are executed without session issues."
2. "Access is denied or redirected to the login page."
3. "Cookies are flagged as `Secure` and `HttpOnly`, and sensitive data is not exposed."

title: Sensitive Data Exposure
description: Ensure sensitive information is not exposed in the frontend or network traffic.
preconditions:
* Newest version of Google Chrome is installed, network connection is stable.
* The demo Prestashop is open in browser.
* The user has appropriate permissions to view and interact with the website.
postconditions: Potential data exposure risks are documented.
steps_actions:
1. "Log in and navigate through the application, performing standard actions (e.g., checkout, viewing user details)."
2. "Use DevTools to inspect network requests during actions."
3. "Inspect page source and console logs for any sensitive data."
steps_result:
1. "Application behaves as expected without exposing sensitive information."
2. "Sensitive data (e.g., passwords, payment details) is not visible in plaintext."
3. "No sensitive data is exposed in HTML or JavaScript logs."

title: Password Security
description: Verify the robustness of password policies.
preconditions:
* Newest version of Google Chrome is installed, network connection is stable.
* The demo Prestashop is open in browser.
* The user has appropriate permissions to view and interact with the website.
postconditions: Password policies and mechanisms are validated.
steps_actions:
1. "Attempt to register a new account using a weak password (e.g., \"12345\")."
2. "Attempt to reset a password using the \"Forgot Password\" feature."
3. "Inspect password change requests using browser tools to ensure data is transmitted securely."
steps_result:
1. "Registration is denied with a message requiring stronger passwords."
2. "A password reset link is sent to the registered email; the password is never exposed."
3. "Passwords are never transmitted in plaintext over the network."
